summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) to the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) transmitting a draft report on the investigation into the custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It requests an official BOP response by June 16, 2023, and contains strict confidentiality instructions regarding the draft report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG's draft investigation report concerning his custody, care, and supervision while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: OIG Transmits Draft Epstein Custody Report to BOP
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General sends its draft investigation report on the BOP's handling of Jeffrey Epstein to the Bureau of Prisons for official response.

events.title: Deadline for BOP Response to OIG Report
events.description: The deadline set by the OIG for the Federal Bureau of Prisons to submit its official response to the draft investigation report.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an investigation into the Federal Bureau of Prisons' custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein.
The investigation focused specifically on Epstein's time at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
A draft report of the investigation was completed and transmitted to the BOP on June 15, 2023, for an official response.
The memorandum imposes strict confidentiality, prohibiting dissemination or discussion of the draft report outside those BOP employees necessary to formulate the official response.
The BOP's official response was to be appended to the final publicly released version of the report.
